column4: Can someone help me install my Microsoft MN-510 Wireless USB network adapter?
I've tried installing the linux-wlan-ng drivers, and it failed to compile.
what does lspci have to say?
type it at console to show info on hardware
maybe it's lsusb in you case
did you get that last comment?
ok, what does iwconfig say?
It says: lo no wireless extensions. wlan0 no wireless extensions.
and which module would that be?..
not sure, look through the output of lsmod to see if it is loaded
no, I said I tried to install it, but it wouldn't make.
someone here said that this tutorial worked for your card http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=121393
ook, i didnt realize that
a repository? I can't even connect to my network :c
ah, that was my problem 30seconds ago
I don't have a NIC in this machine, only a crappy wireless usb adapter.
the built in wireless in my laptop i cannot get to work with linux, but i put a belkin wifi-usb dongle in and had full netowork in 5seconds
you could download the .deb packages for linux-wlan-ng from a repository on another computer and move them over and install
How do I access a repository from Windows XP then?
and if you do, make sure you have any and all dependancies required for it
just goto its website in firefox
ookay, I'm having trouble finding a URL for a repository...
